title: State of the Season: Coming up on mid-season

replies.body:
What does Riot think about how many tanks are often just being able to outright out-damage bruisers and carries, despite building little to no damage items at all?

As it is, TK is able to assassinate lone carries by himself without building any damage whatsoever. 

Is this a design philosophy? That tanks shouldn't rely on utility and teamwork, but raw stats?
_deleted_
WHY {{champion:238}} WHY!

I've had this thought on towers for a while, why don't they do True Damage?

It would be nice to feel like diving is a great risk but with a great reward. As they are currently, towers feel more like an inconvenience to a diver, rather than a risk. 

And if not True Damage, why do towers only do Physical Damage and no Magic Damage? 

Again, if towers did both Physical and Magic damage, the risk would be greater, but that's the whole point of diving.

That would be great if they implemented something like that, i see so many tanks with tons of armor just tanking turrets for their team. Perhaps rather than changing the damage types towers should get reinforced by the presence of allied champions?
I particularly love the idea of champions strengthening towers. That would be more interesting as to do that, it might mean abandoning a lane to save another but it could be very fruitful too.

added magic damage for sure... teams just build armour and then its dont even notice tower taking 7-8 hits still buckets of health left.. there would be far more strategy and questions asked b4 diving a tower... get kill quick get out or you will be outplayed... i guess im saying towers arent respected anymore... and they should be, 2v1 bot you should feel safe under your tower at full health. or whats the point in having a tower?

Annie is not really in a good spot right now. Sure, in balance terms she's fine, but in feel she needs some changes. It doesn't feel good when Annie flash combos your entire team, there isn't enough combo potential and there's literally no skill involved on her end. It also feels bad for Annie when she is forced to use flash defensively, as it is pretty much required to get your abilities off.

Honestly I'm really excited about the mage updates, pretty much every update so far has successfully made champs stronger while still keeping the reason why they're fun intact.

what are you talking about when you say "they're not even giving us solo que"? you can easily just queue up for ranked games by yourself. is there something i'm missing here?

Queuing by yourself into a potential 2-4 man premade is not an accurate representation of a player's individual skill.

Also people who queue together are generally less likely to assist any of their teammates that aren't in their premade, and tend to gang up on them in chat if they're not doing well.
It's a team game. Why does it need to be a representation of individual skill? It needs to be a representation of how well you can fit into and work as a part of a team to achieve the objective.

Sorry Ninjanomikz, but that's on you if you've got no one to play with. It's ultimately a team game and always has been.

What if killing inhib and nexus towers lowered the death timers on the enemy teams? So if you team wipe and you have a bunch of towers to push through you will get through some but not all of them, before the enemy team has spawned.

Thoughts anyway...

Okay, so I think you need to work on turret target acquisition. I've lost count of how many times I've been under tower being harassed or engaged by enemies who are completely within turret range, and staying there, and the turret continues to target minions. I've also lost count of how many times I've been continuously attacked by towers whilst being well and truly outside of tower range (standing on the other side of the heal relic pad on Howling Abyss as Ezreal, for instance).
